title: Diminutive yet tenacious Faf de Klerk makes biggest contribution to South Africa's semi-final win
text:
In another life, South Africa scrum-half Faf de Klerk was born a Pomeranian. Preened to within an inch of his life, De Klerk is both incessantly yappy and entirely unaware of his size in relation to other, bigger dogs that can actually inflict some damage.

In one instance in Sunday's semi-final victory over Wales, De Klerk held both Gareth Davies and Jake Ball by the scruff of their shirts. Davies is hardly the most intimidating figure you could encounter in a dark alley, but even at 5ft 10in still towers over De Klerk. Squaring up to a fellow scrum-half is one thing, but De Klerk – all 5ft 7in of him – decided that was not enough.

No, he needed to simultaneously threaten a 6ft 6in second row....
description: In another life, South Africa scrum-half Faf de Klerk was born a Pomeranian.
